user_interface.py

1 #! /usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """!
4 
5 @file user_interface.py
6 <div><b>ROS Node Name</b>
7  <ul><li>user_interface</li></ul></div>
8 @brief a very simple user interface from shell
9 
10 @authors Carmine Tommaso Recchiuto
11 @version v1.0
12 
13 <b>Description:</b> <br>
14 <p>
15 When the simulation is started, the console asks to press '1' to start
16 the motion of the robot, and to press '0' for stopping the motion. This is
17 the interface this node provides to the user. The node interacts with the
18 node @ref state_machine.cpp : when the user sends '1', the command "start"
19 is sent to the state_machine.cpp node. "stop" is sent when the user presses
20 any other key different from '1'. <br><br>
21 There's no error handling. Just a simple implementation.
22 </p>
23 
24 <b>Clients:</b> <br>
25 <ul>
26  <li>
27  <i>/user_interface</i> : Command.srv <br>
28  see the service \ref state_machine.cpp <br><br>
29  </li>
30 </ul>
31 
32 <b>TODOs</b><br>
33 @todo review the logs from this node
34 
35 """
36 
37 import rospy
38 import time
39 from rt2_assignment1.srv import Command
40 
41 def main():
42  rospy.init_node('user_interface')
43  ui_client = rospy.ServiceProxy('/user_interface', Command)
44  time.sleep(10)
45  rate = rospy.Rate(20)
46  x = int(input("\nPress 1 to start the robot "))
47  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
48  if (x == 1):
49  ui_client("start")
50  x = int(input("\nPress 0 to stop the robot "))
51  else:
52  print("Please wait, the robot is going to stop when the position will be reached")
53  ui_client("stop")
54  x = int(input("\nPress 1 to start the robot "))
55 
56 if __name__ == '__main__':
57  main()
user_interface.main
